Sentencas: A low-temperature sealing approach, transient liquid phase bonding with Ni?Sn system, was employed to seal metal-supported solid oxide fuel cell (MS-SOFC) components in this study.
Titulo: A low-temperature sealing method for metal-supported oxide fuel cell applications: Ni?Sn transient liquid phase bonding

Sentencas: The Ni layer was prefabricated on the ferritic stainless steels by electroplating firstly, and then were vacuum annealed to enhance the bonding between the Ni coating and the steel substrate.
Titulo: A low-temperature sealing method for metal-supported oxide fuel cell applications: Ni?Sn transient liquid phase bonding

Sentencas: Afterward, the Ni coated steels were transient liquid phase bonded using a thin interlayer of pure Sn.
Titulo: A low-temperature sealing method for metal-supported oxide fuel cell applications: Ni?Sn transient liquid phase bonding

Sentencas: Effects of bonding temperature (250?400 ?C) and holding time (10?60 min) on the interface of joints were investigated.
Titulo: A low-temperature sealing method for metal-supported oxide fuel cell applications: Ni?Sn transient liquid phase bonding

Sentencas: The interfacial microstructure of joints was observed by the scanning electron microscope and the transmission electron microscope.
Titulo: A low-temperature sealing method for metal-supported oxide fuel cell applications: Ni?Sn transient liquid phase bonding

Sentencas: A joint with full intermetallic compounds (IMCs) of Ni3Sn4 and Ni3Sn2 were formed at 400 ?C/60 min.
Titulo: A low-temperature sealing method for metal-supported oxide fuel cell applications: Ni?Sn transient liquid phase bonding

Sentencas: These Ni?Sn IMCs were all stable up to 794.5 ?C, ensuring that the joint with full IMCs microstructure can be performed at the operating temperature of -600 ?
Titulo: A low-temperature sealing method for metal-supported oxide fuel cell applications: Ni?Sn transient liquid phase bonding
A low-temperature sealing method for metal-supported oxide fuel cell applications: Ni?Sn transient liquid phase bonding

Sentencas: Furthermore, the residual Ni coating can also be served as a protective layer for the stack.
Titulo: A low-temperature sealing method for metal-supported oxide fuel cell applications: Ni?Sn transient liquid phase bonding
